about.summary: Bindings to 'ImageMagick': the most comprehensive open-source image processing library available. Supports many common formats (png, jpeg, tiff, pdf, etc) and manipulations (rotate, scale, crop, trim, flip, blur, etc). All operations are vectorized via the Magick++ STL meaning they operate either on a single frame or a series of frames for working with layers, collages, or animation. In RStudio images are automatically previewed when printed to the console, resulting in an interactive editing environment. The latest  version of the package includes a native graphics device for creating  in-memory graphics or drawing onto images using pixel coordinates.

name: r-magick

Supports many common formats (png, jpeg, tiff, pdf, etc) and manipulations (rotate, scale, crop, trim, flip, blur, etc). raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.8.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-magick
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/magick_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/magick/magick_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 45c803370f0d96b729db8114b3e2187cbe6fac13133b67b96a91c8eae734ea0a

build:
  # imagemagick package not available on win
  skip: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-rcpp                       # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-magrittr                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-curl                       # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}          # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}    # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}      # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}grep              # [win]
    - {{ posix }}autoconf
    - {{ posix }}automake          # [not win]
    - {{ posix }}automake-wrapper  # [win]
    - pkg-config
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.12
    - r-curl
    - r-magrittr
    - imagemagick
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.12
    - r-curl
    - r-magrittr
    - {{ pin_compatible('imagemagick', max_pin='x.x.x') }}

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('magick')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('magick')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://docs.ropensci.org/magick
  dev_url: https://github.com/ropensci/magick
  license: MIT
  summary: "Bindings to 'ImageMagick': the most comprehensive open-source image processing library available. Supports many common formats (png, jpeg, tiff, pdf, etc) and manipulations (rotate, scale, crop, trim, flip, blur, etc). All operations are vectorized via the Magick++ STL meaning they operate either on a single
    frame or a series of frames for working with layers, collages, or animation. In RStudio images are automatically previewed when printed to the console, resulting in an interactive editing environment. The latest  version of the package includes a native graphics device for creating  in-memory graphics or drawing onto
    images using pixel coordinates."
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
